section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section introduces the fundamental concepts of variables and data types in Python. Students will learn how to store data using variables, understand the core built-in data types, work with numerical data, manipulate text with strings, and convert between different data types when necessary.
learning_objectives: Assign values to variables using proper naming conventions
Identify and utilize Python's core built-in data types
Perform basic arithmetic operations with numerical data types
Manipulate and format string data using various methods
Convert values between different data types using type casting

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare variables using proper Python syntax and naming conventions
key_topics: Variable assignment syntax using the equals sign
Python variable naming rules and conventions
Checking variable types with the type() function

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables for storing a person's name, age, and favorite color using proper naming conventions
Declare a variable with an initial value, then reassign it to a different value and print both values

lessons.lesson_title: Core Data Types: Numbers and Booleans
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to work with integer, float, and boolean data types in mathematical operations
key_topics: Integer data type for whole numbers
Float data type for decimal numbers

exercises.exercise_instructions: Perform various arithmetic calculations using integers and floats, including division with different operators
Create variables that store boolean values based on comparison operations (>, <, ==, !=)

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create, manipulate, and format string data using various methods
key_topics: String creation using single, double, and triple quotes
String concatenation with the plus operator
String methods: upper(), lower(), strip(), replace()

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a string and apply various string methods to transform its content and format
Use f-strings to create formatted messages that incorporate multiple variables

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to convert between data types and check variable types programmatically
key_topics: Type conversion functions: int(), float(), str(), bool()

exercises.exercise_instructions: Convert values between different data types and handle potential conversion errors
Create a function that checks the type of input and performs different actions based on the data type
